messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@index` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full path
- /v1/posts

All methods acceptable
- false

Methods accepted (based on the routes in the provided code)
- HEAD: false
- POST: true
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation
- routes/api.php registers Route::prefix('v1')..., and within that it calls Route::apiResource('posts', PostController::class)->only(['index', 'show']); which creates the index route at GET /v1/posts. Therefore GET is accepted for /v1/posts.
- The same file also registers an authenticated group (middleware ['auth:sanctum', 'verified']) that calls Route::apiResource('posts', PostController::class)->only(['update', 'store', 'destroy']); The store action maps to POST /v1/posts, so POST is registered for the same path (but protected by middleware). Because the route is present in code, POST is marked true (even though it requires authentication at runtime).
- PUT/PATCH/DELETE are only registered for the resource routes that include a {post} parameter (update/destroy) and therefore apply to /v1/posts/{post}, not to /v1/posts — so they are false for this path.
- HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE are not explicitly registered in the provided route definitions. The code does not define explicit HEAD/OPTIONS/TRACE handlers for /v1/posts, and there is no catch‑all route that would make "all methods" true, so these are marked false.
- "All methods acceptable" is false because no route in the provided code accepts every HTTP method for this path.
